result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:41 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Fox, Defendant Daniel John Craven LaPean in court.  Attorney Nicholas Von Davis in court for Daniel John Craven LaPean.  Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Davis states the case is not resolved and a global  resolution is pending. 21CF930 is the driving case. Atty Davis requests to set out to allow time to review the resolution. Atty Davis waives time limits in this case - 22CF352. Court approves another branch to hear this case in the event of a global resolution and sets next hearing with Branch II. Parties to schedule with JA if there is not a global resolution.

Pretrial Assessment Report. arc
Status conference on July 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Seth B.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 22CF352 (INIT), 21CF930 & 22CF147 (RW-FTP):
CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:   Michelle P Brekken   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson for purposes of today  DF:  Daniel John Craven Lapean appeared from jail via video. Case called at 1:10 p.m. DE has a copy of complaint on 22CF352. Address and DOB confirmed. Understands charges and penalties. Does not qualify for PD services. Atty Davis is appointed on other files. Court will appoint Atty Davis on 22CF352. Atty Harrelson argues bond. DE states the failure to pay he can pay. Court will QUASH WARRANTS in 21CF930 & 22CF147. Must bring payments current by next Friday. Needs to make June payment on Wednesday. Reminded will not receive text messages for payment reminders. Has Court prior in Branch 2. Atty Harrelson waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  Status conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.
